contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{taxobox |name = ''Engelhardia'' |image = Engelhardtia_spicata_Blanco2.387-cropped.jpg |image_caption = ''[[Engelhardia spicata]]'' Lesch ex Blume |regnum = [[Plant]]ae |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] |unranked_ordo = [[Rosids]] |ordo = [[Fagales]] |familia = [[Juglandaceae]] |genus = '''''Engelhardia''''' |subdivision_ranks = Species |subdivision = 7: See text. |}} '''''Engelhardia''''' is a [[genus]] of seven species of [[tree]]s in the family [[Juglandaceae]], native to southeast [[Asia]] from northern [[India]] east to [[Taiwan]], [[Indonesia]] and the [[Philippines]]. The genus name is commonly misspelled "''Engelhardtia''", a "correction" made by the original author Blume in 1829 and persistent until today, as it was thus entered in the ''[[Index Kewensis]]''; the original spelling is ''Engelhardia''. ''Engelhardia'' pollen has been found in deposits of [[Miocene]] Age in [[Denmark]].<ref>Larsson et al. (2006) Early Miocene pollen and spores from western Jylland, Denmark – environmental and climatic implications. GFF 128 (3): 261-272</ref> ==Species== *''[[Engelhardia apoensis|E. apoensis]]'' Elmer ex Nagel, native to [[Malay Peninsula|Malaya]], [[Borneo]], the [[Philippine Islands|Philippines]] *''[[Engelhardia cathayensis|E. cathayensis]]'' Dode *''[[Engelhardia hainanensis|E. hainanensis]]'' Chen, native to [[China]] *''[[Engelhardia nudiflora|E. nudiflora]]'' Hook. f. *''[[Engelhardia rigida|E. rigida]]'' Blume, native to [[Java]], Borneo, [[New Guinea]], the Philippines *''[[Engelhardia roxburghiana|E. roxburghiana]]'' Wall. (syn. ''E. chrysolepis'' Hance, ''E. fenzelii'' Merr.) ''huang qi'' in Chinese ({{zh|c=黃杞}}) *''[[Engelhardia serrata|E. serrata]]'' Blume, native to southwest China, [[Indochina]], [[Indonesia]], and the Philippines **''[[Engelhardia serrata|E. serrata]]'' var. ''cambodica'' W. E. Manning *''[[Engelhardia spicata|E. spicata]]'' Lesch ex Blume, native to [[Nepal]], southern [[Asia]], the Philippines, and New Guinea **''[[Engelhardia spicata|E. spicata]]'' var. ''integra'' (Kurz) W.E. Manning ex Steen., Fl. Males. I, 6: 953 (1972); Grierson & Long, Notes Roy. Bot. Gard. Edinburgh 40: 133. (1982), isonym; syn. var. ''colebrookiana'' (Lindl.) Koorders & Valeton *''[[Engelhardia ursina|E. ursina]]'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon_id=111689 Flora of China: ''Engelhardia''] [[Category:Engelhardia| ]] {{Fagales-stub}}
